document_data.name: Nagarr
document_data.exports: Wool, [[fish]] (from the Nagawater), and (by [[1370 DR]]) trade
document_data.mainbody: '''Nagarr''', sometimes marked as '''Kagarra''' on maps,{{Cite web enhancement/Environs of Waterdeep|12}} also named '''Yacla''' around the 9th century [[DR]], In [[1370 DR]], it was a protectorate of [[Ankhapur]].
document_data.Geography: The village sat on the southwest bank of the [[Nagawater]] upstream from where the [[Nagaflow]] began. It was on the fringes of the land between the Nagawater and the [[Winterwood]] called the [[Serpents' Holding]]. The [[Ankh Road]] connected Nagarr with [[Ankhapur]] to the southwest, paved since 1370 DR.
document_data.Government: The mayor in 1370 DR was [[Torgis Hatchetson]]. In reality, the true influences were the merchants along Nagarr's docks and [[Janol Famisso|Janol I]].
document_data.History:
Nagarr was a simple farming-fishing village, but by 1370 DR with the rise of Janol I of Ankhapur, major reconstruction and increase in population as a trade transit point gradually expanded it to accommodate trade.

The most common stories were told in the inns and taverns of Nagarr all involved the monstrous and mysterious [[naga]]. The locals had no idea that separate species of good, evil and neutral naga all lived in the area (which [[Orswin]] failed to do with his attempts) and the consensus was the only good naga was a dead naga.
document_data.Armed forces: As of 1370 DR, 375 members of Ankhpur's Watch were permanently loaned to the Mayor of Nagarr.

Notable locations.Temples: :[[Palace of Justice, Duty, and Sufferance]] ([[The Triad]]: [[Tyr]], [[Torm]], [[Ilmater]]) • [[House of Mysteries]] ([[Mystra (Midnight)|Mystra]]) • [[Shrine to Dawn]] ([[Lathander]])

document_data.Organizations: The [[Red Masks]] was a fledgling organization headed by [[Rathan Silverknife]] who lost in a turf war in [[Innarlith]] and ran to hide in Nagarr in 1370 DR.
document_data.Notable Inhabitants:
*[[Alamandra Whitehair]], a [[cleric]] of [[Mystra (Midnight)|Mystra]] overseeing the [[House of Mysteries]] in 1370 DR, who advocated the appreciation of the wonders and beauty of magic and not just its convenience.
*[[Cadrin Velaclaok]], a cleric of [[Ilmater]] running the small [[The Triad|Triadic]] temple [[Palace of Justice, Duty, and Sufferance]] in 1370 DR.
*[[Cathel deFaux]], an elderly cleric of [[Lathander]] presiding over the newly founded [[Shrine to Dawn]] in 1370 DR, who arrived from outside Nagarr.
*[[Jordan Ariadne]], a [[Half-sea elf]] of the passing [[Aquatic elf|sea elf]] [[Ariadne]]. He was a water [[elementalist]] disciple of a local non-evil [[naga]]. He lived on an anchored sailing vessel with an enclosed cabin and came out to help the farmers with irrigation.
*[[Orswin]], a sage from the North who advocated the the search and study of all varieties of serpents, was drawn to Nagarr because of the naga.
*[[Rathan Silverknife]], the founder of the new local [[Red Masks]] by 1370 DR.
